### Properties of convex function

If $f\in \mathcal{C}^{1}$ then it's convex iff
$$
f(y)-f(x) \ge \left\langle \nabla f(x),y-x \right\rangle
$$
thus, $\nabla f$ is monotone. Moreover, $\nabla^2 f(x)$ is positive semi-definite.

Any local minimum of a convex function is a global minimum.


::: {.lemma  name=""}

Let $\mathcal{X}\subset \mathbb{R}^{n}$ be a closed convex set, $\theta$ and $f$ be convex differentiable. Then
$$
x^{*}\in \argmin \left\{ \theta(x)+f(x) |x \in \mathcal{X} \right\}
$$
iff
$$
\theta(x)-\theta(x^{*})+
\nabla_{x-x^*}f(x^*) \ge 
$$

:::


:::: {.proof}

$\implies$. For any $x\in \mathcal{X}$, we have
$$
\frac{\theta(x_{\alpha})-\theta(x^{*})}{\alpha}+
\frac{f(x_{\alpha})-f(x^{*})}{\alpha} \ge 0
$$
where $x_{\alpha}=(1-\alpha)x^{*}+\alpha x$. Since $\theta$ is convex, it follows that
$$
\theta(x_{\alpha})\le (1-\alpha) \theta(x^{*})+\alpha \theta(x)
$$
reformulate this
$$
\theta(x)-\theta(x^{*}) \ge \frac{\theta(x_{\alpha})-\theta(x^{*})}{\alpha}
$$
that implies
$$
\theta(x)-\theta(x^{*})+\frac{f(x_{\alpha})-f(x^{*})}{\alpha}\ge 0
$$
note
$$
\nabla_{x-x^*}f(x^*)=\lim_{\alpha \to 0} \frac{f(x^*+\alpha (x-x^*))-f(x^{*})}{\alpha}
$$
then claim follows by letting $\alpha \to 0$.

$\impliedby$. By the convexity of $f$, we have
$$
f(x)-f(x^*) \ge \frac{f(x_{\alpha})-f(x^*)}{\alpha}\implies f(x)-f(x^*)\ge \nabla_{x-x^*}f(x^*)
$$
then claim follows.
